brief.brief: The Sequentially Numbered Fields option enables easy access to the Service Manager process for maintaining and retrieving a unique and sequential number when needed.
All unique numbers used within Service Manager come from a central table called "number".
This table stores all different "classes" or sequential numbers, as well as the next available number.
Any application within Service Manager that uses unique numbers obtains it from this table using a supplied subroutine.
The Sequentially Numbered Fields options allow you quick and easy interface to the process of obtaining a unique and sequential number.
You can create and name classes as you need them, but you must create any new classes in the number table you can use them here.
